title: Mission Launch Confirmed
message: All systems nominal. Crew of 6 aboard the ISS-Nebula. Departure from Lunar Base Alpha at 0600 UTC. Course set for Mars orbital station.

title: Micro-Meteorite Impact Detected
message: Hull breach alert on Deck 7. Automated seal deployed. No casualties. Shield integrity dropped to 64%. Engineering team dispatched for inspection.

title: Oxygen Recycler Maintenance
message: Routine maintenance completed on the O2 recycling unit. Efficiency restored to 87%. Next scheduled check in 30 days.

title: Bio-Ration Supply Critical
message: Food reserves have dropped below 20%. Emergency rationing protocol initiated. Resupply shuttle ETA: 14 days.

title: Deep Space Communication Established
message: Successfully established a quantum-link channel with Earth Command. Signal latency at 12 minutes. Data exchange nominal.

title: Unidentified Object on Radar
message: Sensor array picked up an unidentified object at bearing 047-mark-3. Object is non-responsive to hails. Tracking initiated. Crew on standby.

title: Crew Rotation Completed
message: Sleep cycle rotation complete. Team Bravo is now active. All crew members report nominal health metrics. Morale is stable.

title: Plasma Reactor at Maximum Output
message: Reactor output holding steady at 1200 MW. All power distribution systems green. No anomalies detected in the coolant loop.
